reuo.resources

Class Font

  • java.lang.Object
    • reuo.resources.Font
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Loadable

    public class Font
extends java.lang.Object
implements Loadable
    Stores Bitmap glyphs for ASCII characters. Characters are offset by 32 with '\0x20' being the index 0, and 224 being the length of the array of glyphs.
    Author:
    Kristopher Ives, Lucas Green

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Formatter formatter 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Font(int id, Formatter formatter)
      Initializes the font with a resource identifier and a formatter that will be used to format the pixels and provide meta-information about the pixel format.

        public Font(int id,

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        public int getId()
        Gets the resource identifier of this Font.
        Returns:
        the resource identifier (this.id)

      • getGlyphs

        public Bitmap[] getGlyphs()
        Gets the underlying array of glyphs. Changes made to this array are backed by this font.
        Returns:
        the array of glyphs

      • getGlyph

        public Bitmap getGlyph(char glyph)
                throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Gets the array of glyph characters. This should be at least of length 224 and may contain null elements. Any elements outside this range are undefined.
        Returns:
        the bitmap array (this.glyphs)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the requested character is outside the supported ASCII range
        See Also:
        glyphs

      • load

        public void load(java.nio.ByteBuffer in)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: Loadable
        Loads this from the provided data source. The position and limit of the buffer will be respected, however the position is not guaranteed to be the limit after invocation.
        Specified by:
        load in interface Loadable
        Parameters:
        in - the provided data source
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
